comments:
Launch configuration throws an exception when the test asset of a test artifact
is changed.

Problem:
--------

Create a new HTTP recorder file -> Create a new deployment and associate a new
test artifact and location with it -> Create a new launch configuration for your
test case and run it -> Now create a new HTTP recorder file -> double click the
previous test artifact created -> click on the 'More' button under Test Assets
-> Remove the old HTTP recorder file and add the new file that was created ->
click on the Run button -> select Run.

The following error message is displayed: "An error has occurred.  See error log
for more details."

The following error message is generated in the log file:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Jul 09, 2004 14:44:40.561

Fixed.

Please note, after a run configuration is created (with test suite #1 and 
deploymentX for example) and persisted, even if test asset associated with the 
artifact is changed (from test suite #1 to #2 for example), this configuration 
will still execute test suite #1 it persisted. If this run configuration is 
reopened, however, it'll clearly show that test suite #1 is no longer paired 
with any deployment because deploymentX now associated with test suite #2 and 
will not show up on the deployment list.
